channel.title: Portforwarding help
channel.description:
Pretty much my server is ready to go, ive got the no-ip read, the source edited and compiled, only one problem, i cant portforward anything. My router is: Qwest
I went and read some tuts, and the tuts pretty much said "If you know the username or password, please [u]Click here[/u] to submit it to us."
Ive seen that on all the tuts ive looked at about my router. If anyone can help me, tell me a diff way to do this, or can help with the qwest router, it would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.

item.description:
@kaoticvela74 wrote:

still no luck, can anyone else help me, do i even need to portforward to host my server? some people said they didnt… help?

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding help
item.dc:creator: @gobabygo6 gobabygo6
item.description:
@gobabygo6 wrote:

To Stop The Questions About Port Forwarding

  1. first get a static ip. go here to learn how to get a static ip, and forward the static ip and the port to ur router or local internet connection. which u got. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jBvVCAPXsDA that should explain the static ip section.
    2)second, lower all your firewalls, on anti virus’s too. because firewalls make it difficult for people to get on ur game. usually you would go to conroll panel>security center>then at the bottom would be a thing to get to the place to turn your firewall on and off. also, because i dont know your anti virus, i cant tell you how to lower that one.
  2. accept port 43594 on your firewall. to accept that port on your firewall, go to controll panel>security center> then at the bottom of the security center there should be a thing to go to windows firewall. click that. once your in that menue. there should be a tab on the top saying exeptions. click it. click add port. once youve clicked it- the name can be anything, i put moparscape. and the port is 43594
  3. after that, go to www.no-ip.org register and download it.
    5)and your done, if i forgot sumthing or if youre having problems please post and i will fix it[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 16, 2008, 09:27:36 AM[/size][hr]there, a complete, tested and successful port forwarding guide

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @EazyE EazyE
item.description:
@EazyE wrote:

http://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Qwest/Qwest2700HG-D/1st_SMTP_Server.htm

Check that out, if you already did sorry for sending you back to it…

Oh, and also, if you do follow the guide use the mopar port, not the port used in the example.
